title: General
custom_preconds:
Verify that Ford Sync is ENABLED in the config otherwise it won't connect.

Make sure the sync device is in "Drive" mode otherwise the lock screen won't appear on At Bat. 

Enable Bluetooth on the device to pair with Sync
(On Sync, access the Sync-Media menu, press the menu button and select System Settings, Add Bluetooth Device)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user turns on the Sync device
And pairs with an Android device
And selects Mobile Applications from the Sync-Media menu
And selects the At Bat application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ford sync branded screen should appear on the app
And the user should see a Disconnect button but no other buttons.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user give the 'List Games' command
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the games on the scoreboard for that day should be read out loud by the sync system

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user give the 'More' command
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then more games should be read out loud by the sync system

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user gives the Team Name command (eg. 'Yankees') for a team that has a game but the game is not in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the sync system should display '[Team] vs. [Team]', [Game start time]
And the system should display "No feeds"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user gives the Team Name command (eg. 'Yankees') for a team that has a game in progress with live feeds
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the feed detail and game details should be said out loud by the sync system.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user gives the Team Name command (eg. 'Yankees') for a team that does not have any games scheduled on the current day.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the sync system should say "No game for [Team], say list games or a team name to continue."

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user gives the Team Name command (eg. 'Yankees') for a team that has a scheduled game that has not yet begun (but feeds are live.)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the sync system should say "[Away team] vs. [Home team], [Game start time], and [feed name]"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has selected a game with multiple audio feeds
And the user turns the Tune knob on the sync device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the audio feed should change and begin playback successfully.
And the newly selected audio feed should be reflected in the Sync UI.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Reset SYNC Connection' button on the app lockscreen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the sync lockscreen should disappear from the handset
And the user should be able to navigate through and use At Bat on the device. 
And the sync system should display "Mobile Applications"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user gives the Exit command
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the sync lockscreen should disappear from the handset
And the user should be able to navigate through and use At Bat on the device. 
And the sync system should display "Mobile Applications"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user flips the Voice switch (Listen button in an actual automobile)
And says the Cancel command
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the screen on the SYNC system will revert back to the previous state
And the command request is cancelled successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Play command is spoken
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then audio playback for the selected feed will begin successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Pause command is spoken
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the audio playback will stop as per the command given

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Next Feed command is spoken
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the SYNC system will switch over the next available feed for the game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Previous Feed command is given
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the SYNC system will switch from the current feed to the previously played feed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Help command is spoken
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the SYNC system will say "MLB.com At Bat Help"
And will say "You can say: List Games, Play, Pause, Next Feed, Previous Feed, <all 30 teams' names>, Help, Cancel, or Exit"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has set at least one favorite team
And the user has a device connected to the SYNC system
And the user issues the "List Games" command
custom_steps_separated.expected:
When the device is connected to the SYNC system
And the user issues the "List Games" command

custom_steps_separated.content: When the ford sync lockscreen appears on top of at bat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the At Bat/Ford Sync logo
And the user should see the disconnect button.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in progress and data is updating
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game data should update on the Ford Sync Display every 2 minutes or so.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is listening to a game
And the user gives the Next Feed or Previous Feed commands
custom_steps_separated.expected: The the feeds should change and begin playing as expected.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user gives the team command (eg. Yankees) for a team that has a game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game should be announced correctly as "[Away Team] vs. [Home Team], [Inning information], [Leading Team] leads, [x] to [y]"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user changes Audio feeds
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the newly selected audio feed should display on the ford sync display

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user opens the MLB.TV or Audio overlay on an Android Tablet
And the user connects the device to Ford Sync
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ford sync lockscreen should appear and block either of those views.
And the MLB.TV or Audio UI should not be visible on top of the ford sync screen.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game has just ended and is in a "Game over" state in the data but not yet "Final"
And the ford sync announces the game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game status should be announced as "Final" and not "Game Over"

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game has ended and feeds are no longer available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the game should appear in the ford sync display as Final.
And there shoudl be an indication that no feeds are available.
